revisions.rev:
{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=1996 |Team=Northwestern Wildcats |Image=Northwestern N logo.gif |Conference=Big Ten Conference |Division= |ShortConference=Big Ten |Record=9-3 |ConfRecord=7-1 |HeadCoach=[[Gary Barnett]] |CoachRank=16 |APRank=15 |OffCoach= |DefCoach= |OScheme= |DScheme= |StadiumArena=[[Ryan Field (stadium)|Dyche Stadium]] |Champion= Big Ten Champions |BowlTourney={{alternate links|1997 Florida Citrus Bowl|Florida Citrus Bowl|title=Florida Citrus Bowl}} vs. [[1996 Tennessee Volunteers football team|Tennessee]] |BowlTourneyResult= L 48-28 }} {{1996 Big Ten football standings}} The '''1996 Northwestern Wildcats football team''' represented [[Northwestern University]] in the [[1996 NCAA Division I-A football season|1996 NCAA Division I-A college football season]].
==Season== Northwestern finished the season with a 9-3 record. Under head coach [[Gary Barnett]], the Wildcats won a share of the Big Ten title for the second straight year. They faced off against [[1996 Tennessee Volunteers football team|Tennessee]] in the {{alternate links|1997 Florida Citrus Bowl|Florida Citrus Bowl|title=Florida Citrus Bowl}} where the Wilcats' season came to an abrupt halt with a 48-28 loss.
